author: WillPittenger
body:
### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

When PowerShell replaced cmd.exe, the old `xcopy` command was lost.  Oh, it still works, but doesn't run natively.  We have `Copy-Item`, but it doesn't preserve the directory structure.  All files are simply copied to the destination folder rather than several folders down.  To me, a simple switch solves that problem.

### Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

_No response_

comments.author: WillPittenger
comments.body: As I said, it flattens the structure.  If you issue `copy ~ v:\ -recurse`, yes, it will recurse.  But all items in `~\AppData`, even if several levels down, will be placed directly in `v:\`.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I guess you catch a bug with coping to root folder.

comments.author: WillPittenger
comments.body: It isn't just roots of drives.  If you search Google for "PowerShell xcopy", you'll see people discussing how to solve the problem.  Did you try it?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Copy-Item can copy directory structure. But PowerShell providers (including FileSystem provider and Copy-Item cmdlet) have many bugs and many ones already registered in the repository. Please use search. If you can not find please create new issue with clear repro steps and fill all fields in issue template.

comments.author: jhoneill
comments.body:
> As I said, it flattens the structure. If you issue `copy ~ v:\ -recurse`, yes, it will recurse. But all items in `~\AppData`, even if several levels down, will be placed directly in `v:\`.

I can't copy all of my windows ~ because itis > 100GB but in WSL I tried
```
 New-PSDrive -Name v -PSProvider FileSystem -Root <<temp folder>>
copy ~ V:\ -recurse -verbose 
```
And it copied correctly, creating a \<\<username\>\> folder to copy into


Generally I find on windows 
```
copy <somedir> <somewhere> -recurse
```
 is fine , even empty directories are copied. 

In the windows sandbox on windows 11 I tried 
```
copy ~ c:\ -Recurse
```
This gave some errors about permissions to some folders but everything went into c:\WDAGUtilityAccount

Can you give some better repro instructions, because as Ilya says there are some known bugs, but this "flattening" doesn't seem to happen _commonly_ in either 5.1 or 7.2.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: Aye, as the others said this sounds more like a bug; `-Recurse` is meant to fill this functionality. Can you please copy the Bug Report template and fill that out so we have better context to address issue here?

title: Add `-MaintainDirectoryStructure` to `Copy-Item`
